question.title: Iruka And Marks
question.content:
Iruka Umino is the instructor at the shinobi school at Konoha. He took a test of all the students in his class and evaluated their answer sheets on a grade of 100. He has ‘N’ number of students in his class.

You are given an ‘N’ and then you are provided with ‘N’ students with their names and marks.

You have to organize the list of students in such a way that students with higher marks come first and in the case of students with equal marks, the student with lexicographically smaller names comes first.

Example:-
Input: ‘N’ = 3, ‘STUDENTS’ = [[‘naruto’, 50], [‘sasuke’, 95], [‘sakura’, 65]]

Output: [[‘sasuke’, 95], [‘sakura’, 65], [‘naruto’, 50]]

In the example above you can see that ‘sasuke’ got the highest marks so he came first in the output followed by ‘sakura’ and ‘naruto’ with the lowest marks.
Input Format :
The first line will contain the integer 'T', denoting the number of test cases.

For each test case, the first line will contain a single integer 'N', the number of students in the class.

The next ‘N’  line contains two elements first is a string representing the name of the student and the second is an integer denoting the marks of the student.
Output format :
For each test case print the elements in the defined order above.
Note :
You don't need to print anything. It has already been taken care of. Just implement the given function.
Constraints :
1 <= T <= 10
1 <= N <= 10^5
1 <= L <= 20
0 <= M <= 100
The Sum of the value of N for all the test cases is <= 10^5.
Time Limit: 1 sec

Here ‘L’ is the size of the string representing the name of the student and ‘M’ is the marks of the student.

Sample Input 1 :
2
3
naruto 50
sakura 65
sasuke 95
2
kiba 70
shikamaru 78
Sample Output 1 :
sasuke 95
sakura 65
naruto 50
shikamaru 78
kiba 70
Explanation Of Sample Input 1 :
For the first case:-
You can see that ‘sasuke’ got the highest marks so he came first in the output followed by ‘sakura’ and ‘naruto’ with the lowest marks.

For the second case-
Here ‘shikamaru’ got 78 marks greater than 70 so he comes first followed by ‘kiba’ with 70 marks.
Sample Input 2 :
2
5
minato 92
sakumo 87
itachi 99
madara 92
ino 80
3
minato 90
madara 90
hiruzen 90
Sample Output 2 :
itachi 99
madara 92
minato 92
sakumo 87
ino 80
hiruzen 90
madara 90
minato 90

rephrased.body: Given a list of students, each with a name and a score, arrange them in descending order of their scores. If two students have the same score, sort them lexicographically by their names in ascending order. Implement the `arrangeStudents` function to achieve this sorting.
constraints: 1 <= L <= 20 (L is the length of the student's name)
The sum of N across all test cases does not exceed 10^5.

testcases.explanation: Sasuke has the highest score (95), followed by Sakura (65) and Naruto (50).
Shikamaru has a higher score (78) than Kiba (70).
Itachi has the highest score (99). Madara and Minato both have 92, but Madara comes before Minato lexicographically. Sakumo has 87 and Ino has 80.
Minato, Madara, and Hiruzen all have the same score (90). They are sorted lexicographically, resulting in Hiruzen, then Madara, then Minato.
Guy has the highest score (90). The remaining students have equal scores so they are sorted lexicographically.
